name: Typographer
description:
Format text with typographic features traditionally used in ﬁne printing — en- and em-dashes, curly quotes, apostrophes, ellipses, and more.

🧐 Formatting Rules

– Replaces straight quotes (") with curly quotes (“ and ”)
– Replaces prime (') with apostrophe (’)
– Replaces one or two dashes with an en-dash (–)
– Replaces three dashes with an em-dash (—)
– Replaces three consecutive dots (...) with an ellipsis (…)
– Uses non-breaking and thin spaces for punctuation
